title: Epstein Files Are Missing Records About Woman Who Made Claim Against Trump
summary: Documents released by the Justice Department briefly mention a woman’s unverified accusation that Donald J. Trump assaulted her in the 1980s, when she was a minor. But several memos related to her account are not in the files.

title: Larry Summers Will Resign From Harvard After Jeffrey Epstein Revelations
summary: Mr. Summers, former president of the school, had stepped back from teaching after documents showed a closer relationship to Jeffrey Epstein than previously known. He will leave at the end of the academic year.

title: Maurene Comey, a Prosecutor in Epstein Case, Joins New York Law Firm
summary: Maurene Comey is joining Patterson Belknap Webb & Tyler. She was abruptly fired by the Trump administration last year after a career as a top federal prosecutor.

title: Trump Puts On a Show, Casting Democrats as the Villains
summary: On the defensive over the economy and with the midterms approaching, President Trump made clear that his political strategy is to paint Democrats as unpatriotic and ‘crazy.’

title: 6 Takeaways From Trump’s State of the Union
summary: In an address that was heavy on theatrics, President Trump lashed out at Democrats as “crazy” and unpatriotic.

title: How The Times Handles the Congressional Hearing Circus
summary: Three editors in Washington discuss their approach to coverage of politicians and witnesses who sometimes seem to be performing for the cameras.

title: Trump Says Tech Firms Should Pay More for Electricity
summary: The president said he had negotiated a deal with tech giants to cover the energy costs of data centers, but offered few details. Experts said such pledges could prove difficult in practice.

title: Yondr Pouches, a Solution to School Phone Bans, Are No Match for Teens
summary: In some schools, Yondr, a pouch marketed to keep kids off devices, has proved no match for actual children.

title: F.B.I. Raids Home of L.A.U.S.D. Chief Alberto Carvalho and School District Offices
summary: F.B.I. agents executed search warrants at the locations. The target of their investigation was unclear.

title: Online Accusations in Guthrie Abduction Leave One Family ‘Scared Numb’
summary: A fifth-grade teacher and his principal wife hid in their bedroom as dozens of people who believed he might be a kidnapper appeared on their suburban street.

title: Super-Agers’ Brains Have a Special Ability, New Study Suggests
summary: The findings may help explain why this group has such exceptional memory.

title: Writers Are Being Targeted by Scams. This Reporter Knows the Feeling.
summary: From George Saunders to the National Book Foundation, the literary world has been besieged by fake requests. Just like me.

title: Inside Nicolás Maduro’s Last Days as Venezuela’s Leader
summary: The Venezuelan leader overestimated his strength and misread his exchange with President Trump in the decisive weeks before his capture by U.S. forces.

title: The Rise and Fall of a Notorious Florida Nudist Colony
summary: The owners have put a 67-year-old nudist colony on the market, hoping a new steward can help it shed its troubled past.

title: In N.C. Senate Race, Democrats Bet Roy Cooper Can Beat Trump’s Endorsement
summary: The race is one of a handful of competitive Senate elections this year, but Democrats seem most confident about North Carolina, partly because their candidate, former Gov. Roy Cooper, has never been beaten.

title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott Spent Millions on Attack Ads Against Jasmine Crockett
summary: Gov. Greg Abbott hopes the ads featuring the Democrat will galvanize Republican voter turnout in November.

title: Best and Worst Moments From Trump’s State of the Union Address
summary: Eight Opinion writers weigh in on the speech.

title: Germany’s Leader Merz Delivers a Blunt Warning to China on Trade
summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz laid out his complaints in a frank message to his hosts on a trip to Beijing that China had designed to showcase their relationship.

title: A New York City Diner That Served Blind Residents Has Closed Its Doors
summary: When Malibu Diner in Chelsea shut down on Sunday night, it ended a unique breakfast program for older people in the city.

title: BAFTAs 2026 Outburst: What Tourette’s Tics Feel Like
summary: Verbal or physical tics can be a daily struggle. So can dealing with the hurt they may cause.

title: How Bookbinders Helped the Nazis Track Holocaust Victims
summary: Conservation experts helped the Nazi regime inspect church and civil archives to track down people they sought to persecute, a researcher concluded.
